result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

2:35 PM Apprs: CO: S. Needham, Rpr: V. Kasten, Clerk: B Harris, Defendant David Michael Johnson in court, in custody.  Attorney Joel Kenneth Larimore in court for David Michael Johnson.  Prosecuting attorney Erica Ellenwood in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews file. ADA Ellenwood recites joint agreement.  Court reads charge and maximum penalty. DE pleads G to Ct 1- Repeated Sexual Assault of Same Child and Ct 2- Use a Computer to Facilitate a Child Sex Crime in 22CF162. DE sworn. Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea. Attorney's stipulate to the facts. Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of Ct 1 and Ct 2 in 22CF162. On motion of the State without objection, Crt dismisses Ct 3, 4, & 5 in 22CF162.  DE's bail revoked and is to be remanded into custody pending sentencing. Court orders PSI.  Adjourned at 2:55 PM. bph
Sentencing hearing scheduled for November 15, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Sentencing hearing on November 15, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

Court informs def of charges, possible penalties and rights. Def understands.  Waives reading.  NG on all counts.  Waives speedy trial.  Atty Larimore would like to have a STC scheduled.  ADA Ellenwood states all discovery has been sent to defense, DNA test was just received, defense knows of this and will be getting those results soon.  Parties to know if this case will be scheduled for plea or JT will be scheduled.  Bond continues.  Adjourned 8:09 AM. bph  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 31, 2022 at 11:30 am.

Signed by EFV on 03/11/22. arc
Preliminary hearing on March 22, 2022 at 09:00 am.

It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, with juvenile females under the age of 18 and B.L.C.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

If the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bail jumping.
